name: Black Quinoa, Fennel and Celery Salad
description: This salad was a big surprise. It is so simple. I began with a bulb of fennel and some celery that I had on hand in the refrigerator, the remains of a bag of black quinoa, and fresh herbs from my garden, thinking that I would need to add some unexpected ingredients to achieve something interesting. But the contrasts of textures and the crisp, clean flavors of the fennel and celery in a lemony dressing made for a salad that I can’t resist. Slice the fennel and celery as thin as you can.
keywords: appetizer, side dish, dairy-free, gluten-free, halal, healthy, kosher, low cholesterol, low-sodium, low sugar, nut-free, vegan, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1 medium-size fennel bulb (about 10 ounces), quartered, cored and very thinly sliced
1 long or 2 shorter celery sticks, very thinly sliced
2 cups cooked black quinoa (about 3/4 cup uncooked)
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a salad bowl, combine the sliced fennel and celery, the quinoa, parsley and chives.
In a small bowl or measuring cup, whisk together the lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper and olive oil. Toss with the salad and serve.
